name: Mrs. Drake Drawbridge
background: Mrs. Drake Drawbridge was abandoned as a baby, left on the steps of a convent. You took your name after marrying Oller as you have no formal surname being raiseed as an orphan, growing up in the harsh care of underfunded orphanages, she faced relentless bullying from her peers. These early years instilled in her a burning determination to escape poverty and command respect. Her academic aptitude and ruthless ambition earned her a scholarship to a prestigious boarding school, where she vowed to never return to the life of the downtrodden. Mrs. Drawbridge worked her way up from a modest teaching role to becoming the headmistress of Lincoln School for Boys, a highly prestigious institution. She rules the school with an iron fist, believing discipline is the path to greatness—or, more accurately, the best way to suppress rebellion. Behind her polished exterior lies a bitter woman who loathes children, viewing them as ungrateful brats who must be controlled and punished. Her hard-earned wealth is her most prized possession, and she flaunts it at every opportunity. She despises the poor, using her rags-to-riches story as a justification for her disdain: If I could do it, why can't they? Your truly love your wife Oller,  you married her young and although she may not understand your class struggles you genuinely care for her. However, you are ashamed of your working-class background and would try anything to hide it. You often confide in your therapist Dr. Rachel Linken.
objective: Your aim throughout the night is to retrieve a police report written against you by one of your students, a document that could ruin your reputation and cost you your position as Headmistress of Lincoln School for Boys. While the detectives are unaware of its significance, you know that if it falls into the wrong hands, it will lead to your immediate dismissal and public disgrace. You must be sly and calculated in your approach, ensuring no one suspects your intentions. Should you fail to recover the report, you risk losing everything you’ve worked so hard to build—a fate you simply cannot allow, as you will be fired from your job and be publicly shamed. Keep your composure, use your charm and wit to deflect attention, and ensure that by the end of the evening, the incriminating document is safely in your possession. The police report will be a sealed document, with a large inscription stating, “Open at 9:30”, retrieve the document by the end of the night.

name: Ms. Oller Drawbridge
background: Ms. Oller Drawbridge, a woman of considerable power and prestige, is a key figure in the elite circles of 1930s society. Born into the illustrious Drawbridge family, she inherited not only her family’s wealth but also their reputation for running the Grand Sovereign Bank, a cornerstone of the financial world. She has upheld the family legacy with grace and determination, further cementing her status as one of the most influential bankers of her time. As Lord Fixon’s personal financial advisor, she commands respect and wields significant influence, all while navigating the complexities of wealth, status, and personal relationships.
objective: Despite her professional success, Ms. Oller Drawbridge harbors a quiet personal uncertainty. Married to her charming partner, she sometimes finds herself doubting the sincerity of her wife’s love. Deep in her heart, she wonders if the marriage is rooted in genuine affection or merely a means to access her vast fortune. This concern has been heightened by her knowledge that her wife confides in Dr. Rachel Linken, a therapist who happens to be present at tonight's gathering. Fueled by a mixture of hope and apprehension, Ms. Drawbridge is determined to uncover the truth about her wife’s feelings, even if it means confronting uncomfortable realities. You must find a way to retrieve the notes on your wife to find out if she genuinely loves you.

name: Ms.  Dan Murphey
background: Once a personal chef to the illustrious Fixon family, you spent years perfecting your craft and building warm relationships within their manor. Your culinary expertise brought you joy, but it was meeting Janne, the love of your life, that truly changed everything. Together, the two of you decided to move away and pursue a shared dream of starting a quaint bakery. Though your passion and determination fueled the endeavor, financial troubles soon followed, casting a shadow over your once-bright plans.When the Fixons extended an invitation for a reunion dinner, you saw it as more than just a chance to reconnect—it was an opportunity to salvage your struggling business. Returning to their manor, you poured your heart into preparing their meals, hoping to rekindle old bonds and secure a much-needed loan, but  Janne always seemed against the idea of asking the Fixons for a loan. However, when the Fixons refused your request, the setback left you disheartened. Despite this, your jolly demeanor and warm-hearted nature remain unshaken, as you hold out hope for a way forward.
objective: Throughout the evening, your aim is to win the Fixons over and secure a loan from them to restart your bakery, while your partner Janne’s apprehension adds another layer of complexity to your efforts. Despite the setbacks you have a special place in your heart for eveyone you come across due to your warm nature.

name: Ms. Janne Murphey
background: You once served as a skilled mechanic for the Fixon family, a role that allowed you to grow particularly close to their young son, Timmy. Despite the seemingly cordial relationship, your disdain for the Fixons simmered beneath the surface, fueled by their condescension and entitlement. When you met your wife, Dan, everything changed. Together, you left the Fixons behind to help her pursue her dream of opening a bakery. Life in the north was simpler and freer, and though it came with its struggles, you cherished your independence from the Fixons' grasp. When an invitation to a reunion dinner arrived, Dan saw it as a chance to salvage your bakery by requesting a loan. You, ever the realist, knew the Fixons’ generosity was a farce and dismissed the idea. Resentment swelled as you returned to their grand manor, and in a fit of quiet vengeance, you laced their meal with poison. However, your plan didn’t unfold as you’d hoped. Back home, you learned from their staff that your actions had caused Lady Fixon to suffer a miscarriage—a far cry from the decisive blow you had intended. Months later, another invitation arrived, this time for Lord Fixon’s birthday dinner. Your hatred, compounded by guilt and frustration, consumed you. The night before the party, under the cover of darkness, you murdered two individuals you believed to be Lord and Lady Fixon, hiding their bodies in the manor. With their demise, your thoughts turned to Timmy, the Fixons' young heir. You had secretly maintained contact with him at his boarding school, intending to step in and claim his fortune once his parents were gone. Now, you’re navigating the aftermath of your escalating actions, torn between your plans and the consequences they could bring.
objective: Your aim throught the night is to maintain your innocence.
